segments.text: I notice the little boy on the stool, reaching for the cookie jar like it’s the most important thing in the world.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The stool looks like it’s about to tip over any second.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: He’s so focused on those cookies that he doesn’t even see how unstable he is.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: His sister is standing right there, waiting for a handout.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I wonder if they’ve done this before and gotten away with it.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The woman at the sink has no idea what’s happening behind her.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I can almost see the fall coming, and it makes me nervous.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The boy’s plate is ready to catch cookies, but I doubt it’ll catch him if he falls.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: This is the kind of moment that ends with tears and bandages.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I hope he gets down safely before the stool gives out.
segments.speaker: PAR
